program: Master of Industrial and Labor Relations (MILR)

sections.text: The MILR develops expertise in human resources, labor relations, and organizational leadership.

items: Core in HR, labor law, and economics
sections.text: Students gain broad ILR foundations and focus in HR or labor relations.
Applicants must have an undergraduate degree and submit SOP, recommendations, and English proficiency.
Graduates work in HR leadership, labor relations, consulting, and organizational development.
